docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 16 -- The two greatest democratic Buenos Aires dailies, Nacion and Prensa, both published long editorials this morning reminding President Edelmiro Farrell that when he was sworn in as Vice President he had undertaken to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 16 -- The two greatest democratic Buenos Aires dailies, Nacion and Prensa, both published long editorials this morning reminding President Edelmiro Farrell that when he was sworn in as Vice President he had undertaken to re-establish the supremacy of the Argentine Constitution and to strengthen democratic institutions.
docs.abstract: Buenos Aires Nacion and Prensa call for free elections and democracy revival

headline.main: 2 Argentine Papers Call on Farrell Regime To Hold Elections and Revive Democracy

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, March 16 (AP) -- The Compania Swift Internacional reported today that consolidated net earnings for 1943 amounted to 20,561,550 Argentine pesos, compared with 17,647,932 pesos in 1942. The earnings, converted into United States currency at a...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, March 16 (AP) -- The Compania Swift Internacional reported today that consolidated net earnings for 1943 amounted to 20,561,550 Argentine pesos, compared with 17,647,932 pesos in 1942. The earnings, converted into United States currency at a rate of 25.16 cents for 1 peso prevailing Dec. 31, 1943, are equivalent to $3.45 a share, compared with $2.77 in 1942.

headline.main: COMPANIA SWIFT'S PROFIT; $3.45 a Share Earned Last Year, Against $2.77 in 1942

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 17 -- Considerable nervousness was noticed in Argentine Government circles today as rumors spread through Buenos Aires that the United States was about to make some important announcement concerning its attitude toward the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 17 -- Considerable nervousness was noticed in Argentine Government circles today as rumors spread through Buenos Aires that the United States was about to make some important announcement concerning its attitude toward the regime of President Edelmiro Farrell.
docs.abstract: Farrell regime uneasy over US stand; Cabinet reorganization seen imminent

headline.main: ARGENTINA JITTERY OVER U.S. ATTITUDE; Farrell's Regime Is Uneasy as Belief Grows That Hull Will Speak Bluntly Soon

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 18 -- The Argentine Government again showed its strong hostility to the press of the United States today by depriving The United Press of all means for the transmission of news, thus making it impossible for the agency to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 18 -- The Argentine Government again showed its strong hostility to the press of the United States today by depriving The United Press of all means for the transmission of news, thus making it impossible for the agency to operate on Argentine territory.
docs.abstract: renews UP ban and forbids telegraph, telephone, cables and teleprinters circuits and mails use

headline.main: ARGENTINA RENEWS UNITED PRESS BAN; Regime Charges That Agency Used Transmission Lines Improperly

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: PARAGUAYAN POSTS FILLED; New Foreign and Education Ministers Named by Morinigo

docs.snippet: FROM Asuncion comes word that Paraguay is having printed in London a group of eleven airmail and eight postage stamps with designs largely of historical significance. Recently the republic adopted a new monetary unit, the guarari, which is equivalent...
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM Asuncion comes word that Paraguay is having printed in London a group of eleven airmail and eight postage stamps with designs largely of historical significance. Recently the republic adopted a new monetary unit, the guarari, which is equivalent to 100 of the discarded peso, and with 100 centimos equaling one guarari. The high values in the forthcoming postal series are guarari denominations.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 28 -- In his first statement to the press since he took office five months ago, Gen. Luis C. Perlinger, Argentine Minister of the Interior, predicted that all the present belligerents would soon unite to fight Russia...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 28 -- In his first statement to the press since he took office five months ago, Gen. Luis C. Perlinger, Argentine Minister of the Interior, predicted that all the present belligerents would soon unite to fight Russia because the middle classes in the United States and Great Britain are so alarmed at the Soviet military successes that they are almost more anti-Russian than anti-German.
docs.abstract: Min Perlinger backs isolation; cites US non-recognition; he is believed to be pol and personal rival of Peron; govt rescinds Dec press decree; Jan decree published

headline.main: ARGENTINE OFFICIAL STIRS ANGER AT U. S.; Cites Non-Recognition to Back Isolation -- Minister Foresees Allies Turning on Russia ARGENTINE OFFICIAL STIRS ANGER AT U. S.

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
